review.title: Arabic Text Categorization Algorithm using Vector Evaluation Method
review.abstract: Text categorization is the process of grouping documents into categories based on their contents. This process is important to make information retrieval easier, and it became more important due to the huge textual information available online. The main problem in text categorization is how to improve the classification accuracy. Although Arabic text categorization is a new promising field, there are a few researches in this field. This paper proposes a new method for Arabic text categorization using vector evaluation. The proposed method uses a categorized Arabic documents corpus, and then the weights of the tested document's words are calculated to determine the document keywords which will be compared with the keywords of the corpus categorizes to determine the tested document's best category.

sections.heading: 1.1.1. Document Preprocessing
sections.text: In this step, HTML tags, rare words and stopwords are removed, and some stammering is required; this can easily be done in English, but is more difficult in Arabic, Chinese, Japanese and some other languages. Words root extraction methods can be helpful in this step to normalize the words of the document. There are several root extraction methods, including morphological analysis of the words and use of the N gram technique [40].

sections.heading: 1.1.2. Document Representation
sections.text: Before classification, documents must be transformed into a format recognized by a computer, with the most commonly used method being the vector space model (VSM), which takes the document as a multidimensional vector and the attribute selected from the dataset as the dimension of that vector.

sections.heading: 1.1.3 Dimension Reduction
sections.text: There are tens of thousands of words in a document, making it impossible to classify all of them as attributes, and the computer cannot process such a large amount of data. Therefore, it is important to select the most meaningful and representative attributes for classification; the most commonly used selection methods include chi-square statistics [4] [38], information gains, mutual information, document frequency, latent semantic analysis.

sections.heading: 1.1.4. Model Training
sections.text: This is the most important part of the text categorization. It includes the selection of some documents from the corpus that make up the training set, carrying out the learning on the training set and creating the model.

sections.heading: 1.1.5. Testing and Evaluation
sections.text: This step uses the model generated from the training step of the model and performs the classification on the test set, then selects the corresponding index to perform evaluations.

sections.text: To investigate the proposed algorithm, a series of Arabic articles covering various topics was selected. sections.heading: 5. CONCLUSIONS AND COMPARISON
sections.text: This paper introduces a new Arabic method of text categorization by means of vector evaluation method. The proposed method determines the keywords of the tested document by weighting each word and then compares these keywords with the keywords of the test corpus. According to the experimental results, the proposed algorithm prepared the documents to ensure a better selection of the maximum amount of documents after the content of the proposed document has been tested 98% in the category and 93% in another category. The proposed method demonstrates the ability to categorize Arabic text documents into the corresponding categories with a high precision rate.
